metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1694 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
browser/browsing_data/browsing_data_remover.cc in Google Chrome before51.0.2704.63 deletes HPKP pins during cache clearing, which makes it easierfor remote attackers to spoof web sites via a valid certificate from anarbitrary recognized Certification Authority.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1694` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242').
